alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Inland Camden; Northeastern Charlton; Southern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 4:47PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NASSAU...NORTH CENTRAL CLAY... DUVAL...SOUTHWESTERN CAMDEN...SOUTHWESTERN BRANTLEY...SOUTHEASTERN WARE AND CENTRAL CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 447 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stephen Foster State Park to Oakleaf Plantation. Movement was north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Orange Park, Hilliard, Folkston, Callahan, Jacksonville International Arpt, Unf, Arlington, Atlantic Beach, and Neptune Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Inland Camden; Northeastern Charlton; Southern Ware; Western Charlton
